column1: jiyax sayang dhuq ku empitu patas hidaw sapah pyasan ka yaku.
column2: I arrived at school at seven today.
column3: 我今天七點到學校。

column1: Prajing sluhay da, mtmay pyasan ka emptgsa, rmngaw ka qbsuran pyasan, “Hiyug! Thmuku!” msa.
column2: It’s time for class , the teacher walked into the classroom, and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”
column3: 上課了，老師走進教室，班長說:「起立!敬禮!」

column1: Paru bi ka hnang nami rmngaw, “emptgsa embiyax su.”
column2: We said loudly, “Hi, teacher.”
column3: 我們大聲的說:「老師好。」

column1: Smluhay nami siida, tmgsa mnan kari seejiq sppgan ka emptgsa.
column2: In class, the teacher taught us the seejiq language of numbers.
column3: 我們上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。

column1: Sneegul nami emptgsa smpug, meuyas nami uyas sppgan.
column2: We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.
column3: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。

column1: Egu bi ka snlhayan mu kari seejiq.
column2: I have learned many seejiq languages.
column3: 我學會好多族語。

column1: Musa ku sapah pyasan kdjiyax, smluhay ku kari seejiq kdjiyax, skari ku kari Seejiq qbhangun mu bubu.
column2: I go to school every day, I learn the seejiq language every day, and I want to tell my mother.
column3: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要說族語給媽媽聽。

column1: Tumun ka hangan mu.
column2: My name is Tumun.
column3: 我的名字是Tumun。

column1: Walis ka hangan tama mu.
column2: My dad’s name is Walis.
column3: 我爸爸的名字是Walis。

column1: Iwan ka hangan bubu mu.
column2: My mother’s name is Iwan.
column3: 我媽媽的名字是Iwan。

column1: Maxal ka hngkwasan mu hngkawas nii.
column2: I am 10 years old.
column3: 我今年10歲。

column1: Niqan ku Kingal qbsuran snaw, Kuras ka hangan na, maxal kingal ka hngkwasan na hngkawas nii.
column2: I have a brother, his name is kuras, he is 11 years old.
column3: 我有一個哥哥，他叫kuras，他今年11歲。

column1: Seupu nami meuyas patas kingal sapah pyasan ka yami.
column2: We study in the same school.
column3: 我們在同一間學校讀書。

column1: Smkuxul meuyas uyas ka yaku ni qbsuran snaw.
column2: Both my brother and I like to sing.
column3: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。

column1: Smkuxul ku tmapaq qsiya ka yaku, msangay o seupu nami musa tmapaq qsiya ka tnsapah.
column2: I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.
column3: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。

column1: Smkuxul ku pkkla bgurah dangi ka yaku, tduwa nami seupu musa meuyas uyas ni tmapaq qsiya.
column2: I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.
column3: 我喜歡交新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。

column1: Laqi ku Seejiq Balay ka yaku.
column2: I am an Seejiq child.
column3: 我是賽德克族的小孩。

column1: Ga nami mniqa Hori.
column2: Our family lives in Hori.
column3: 我們家住在埔里。

column1: Niqan rima hiyi ka tnsapah mu.
column2: There are five people in our family.
column3: 我們家共有五個人。

column1: Niqan tru ka mnswayi nami.
column2: There are three brothers and sisters in our family.
column3: 我們有三個兄弟姊妹。

column1: Gisu ku tuhuy mniq tama, bubu, qbsuran snaw ni qbsuran qrijil.
column2: I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.
column3: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。

column1: Bowqax bi ka tama mu, key-sa-cu ka tama mu.
column2: My father is tall and he is a policeman.
column3: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。

column1: Hlawax ka bubu mu, empsapuh ka bubu mu.
column2: My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.
column3: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。

column1: Mniq sapah o skari kari Seejiq rmngaw mnan ka tama.
column2: My father speaks the ethnic language with us at home.
column3: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。

column1: Msangay rbagan o ida nami musa alang.
column2: We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.
column3: 我們暑假都會回部落。

column1: Yaku ni qbsuran o tuhuy qmraq qpatur.
column2: My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.
column3: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。

column1: Kuxul mu bi ka tnsapah mu.
column2: I like our family very much.
column3: 我很喜歡我們家的人。

column1: Tuhuy ku bubu mu musa rmigaw.
column2: I went out with my mother today.
column3: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。

column1: Mgkarac bi ka karac baraw, ini kskuy ni ini ktalux uri, ltu ka bgihur.
column2: The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.
column3: 白天的天空很藍，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。

column1: Tluung nami babaw sspriq mkan meyn-paw, smbu qbubur ka rdax hidaw, muxul balay.
column2: We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.
column3: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。

column1: Babaw ska hidaw do, maa embanah ka karac da.
column2: In the afternoon, the sky turned red.
column3: 下午，天空變紅了。

column1: Smiling ku bubu mu, ma embanah ka karac baraw hug?
column2: I asked my mother why the sky is red.
column3: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的?

column1: Yabi meiyah ka bgihur paru da, msa ka bubu.
column2: Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.
column3: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。

column1: Keeman ungac rulung ka karac baraw, smriyu ka ppngrah da.
column2: There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.
column3: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。

column1: Mmowsa nami sapah uri da.
column2: We were going home too.
column3: 我們也要回家了。

column1: Mniq ku kska elug seusa sapah, smulu ku ppngrah.
column2: On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,
column3: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。

column1: Tay saw uxay meiyah ka bgihur paru, mkmusa ku bi rmigaw nganguc na.
column2: I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.
column3: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。

column1: Gaga siyaw sapah nami ka sapah pyasan mu, mksa ku musa sapah pyasan kdjiyax, mksa ku meiyah sapah uri.
column2: My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.
column3: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。

column1: Uxay ka paru ka sapah pyasan nami, ini khbaraw ka empeuyas patas mttkla nami kana.
column2: Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.
column3: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。

column1: Mssli tlaman kana ka lqlaqi, tuhuy hmrapas boru, tuhuy pprngaw kari.
column2: All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.
column3: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。

column1: Ida tuhuy mnan mhrapas uri ka emptgsa, saw bi kingal tnsapah ka sapah pyasan.
column2: The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.
column3: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。

column1: Smsik nami kdjiyax ka yami, asi ka bliqun smsik ka pyasan nami.
column2: We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.
column3: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。

column1: Duma seejiq o musa smrus gagi bling, duma seejiq o musa smsik dxgal.
column2: Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.
column3: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。

column1: Ssikun nami kana ka kkmuhing sapah pyasan, mseasug ni mddayaw nami, ida bgurah bi kdjiyax ka sapah pyasan.
column2: We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.
column3: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。

column1: Shiga Mnusa ku alang qmita tama rudan.
column2: Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.
column3: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。

column1: Bsiyaq nami ini tqita da, lnglungun mu bi ka hiya.
column2: We haven’t seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.
column3: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。

column1: Qmita bi knan ka tama rudan do, qlalun ku na sikwa, pmahun ku na ocya.
column2: As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.
column3: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。

column1: Shiya bi ka hnuma sikwa tama rudan, malu bi uqun.
column2: The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.
column3: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。

column1: Kuxul mu bi ka ocya tama rudan uri, malu bi mahun uri.
column2: I also like grandpa’s tea, it’s tasted good too.
column3: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。

column1: Ska hidaw do yaku ni bubu rudan o seupu nami hmapuy uqun ska hidaw.
column2: At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.
column3: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。

column1: Hnapuy egu bi uqun ska hidaw ka bubu rudan, niqan qsurux, niqan rudux, niqan baun, niqan ka pngusul uri.
column2: Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.
column3: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。

column1: Mnkan nami uqun ska hidaw do, musa nami mabal sama smaan.
column2: After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.
column3: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。

column1: Mangal egu bi bunga, sari ni qusul sbgay na knan ka bubu rudan, pdsun na knan musa sapah.
column2: Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.
column3: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。

column1: Mswayay ku dhyaan ni rngagan mu, “yahun namu qmita babaw duri.”
column2: I said goodbye to them and said I’d see them next time.
column3: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。

column1: Jiyax sayang madas mnan musa qlangan ssamac ka emptgsa, msbkug nami rhngun marig kipu.
column2: Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.
column3: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。

column1: Mtmay nami qnalang ssamac do, rmngaw ka emptgsa, “brah o dqduda, bukuy o dquyu, usa nanaq qmita.”
column2: After entering the zoo, the teacher said, There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
column3: so you can visit them yourself.""
column4: 進入動物園後，老師說:「前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。」

column1: Ksugun mu bi ka quyu, uxay ku musa qmita quyu ka yaku.
column2: I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.
column3: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。

column1: Egu bi ka qduda gaga skkaya babaw pusu qhuni.
column2: I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.
column3: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去。

column1: Ruwan qnalang ssamac ga, niqan dapa wiwil muhing, dmai ni rklic, ini mu bi qtai na ka ssamac nii, mqaras ku balay qtaan mu sayang da.
column2: There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.
column3: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。

column1: Egu bi ka pnsingan mu sasing, saun mu pqita tama mu ni bubu mu.
column2: I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.
column3: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。

column1: Babaw do tuhuy ku tama ni bubu miyah ku duri.
column2: Next time I will come with my parents.
column3: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。

column1: Jiyax sngayan nii ga, yaku ni qbsuran qrijil musa nami Taytung qmita swayi snaw tama.
column2: This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.
column3: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。

column1: Kndadax nami Taypey teapa rulu qrngul musa Taytung.
column2: We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.
column3: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。

column1: Dhuq nami Taytung do pgriq rulu miyah smtrung mnan ka swayi snaw tama.
column2: When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.
column3: 到了台東，叔叔開車來接我們。

column1: Sapah swayi snaw tama sdalih tgaan rulu, mgriq rulu o ini biyaw dhuq.
column2: The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.
column3: 車站離叔叔家很近，開車一下子就到了。

column1: Kiyig sapah swayi snaw tama o niqan llabang bi qnalang tbugan, seupu nami teapa ddeynsya musa tbugan.
column2: There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.
column3: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。

column1: Mniq nami ruwan qnalang tbugan hini, madas mnan musa tmabug miric ni teapa dmai ka swayi snaw tama.
column2: In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.
column3: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。

column1: Keeman do seupu nami musa mkan nhapuy sapah uqan.
column2: In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.
column3: 晚上，我們一起去餐廳吃飯。

column1: Ida egu bi rulu ka s-cyu, kiya ni teapa nami utubay musa hiya.
column2: There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.
column3: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。

column1: Mmiyah nami sapah siida, wada guyun da utubay, kiya ni teapa nami basu meiyah sapah da.
column2: When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.
column3: 我們要的時返家時，摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車回家。

column1: Sayang do gaga nami dhuq Taypey da, ya wada slayun ka utubay swayi snaw tama dhug?
column2: Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.
column3: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。

column1: Slaqi ku siida mniq nami Holi, meuyas patas do thjil Taycung da, bitaq sayang gisu nami mniq alang paru na.
column2: When we were young, our family lived in Puli. After I started school, we moved to Taichung and have been living in the city ever since.
column3: 小時候我們家住在埔里，上學以後，就搬到了台中，一直在都市裡生活。

column1: Meuyas ku pyasan paru do, mnegaaw ku kingal quri knkla kndusan seejiq tnpusu slhayan, klaan saw seejiq tnpusu Taywan ga niqan egu kleegan ka knkla kndusan.
column2: After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.
column3: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。

column1: Kiya ni, sngayan rbagan nii do, yaku ni qbsuran snaw ga musa nami alang smiling rudan, mkmkla quri kndusan mnan nanaq.
column2: So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.
column3: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。

column1: Kingal wada mspac kmxalan hngkwasan na rudan, ida mbiyax bi qtaan na.
column2: The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.
column3: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。

column1: Smiling ku hyaan, piya ka klaun su rmngaw kari hug? Ida mkla bi rmngaw kari Seejiq, mkla rmngaw kari Tayal, kari Tanah Tunux uri ka hiya.
column2: I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Seejiq, as well as Atayal and Japanese.
column3: 我問他會哪些語言，他的賽德克語說得很流利，也會說泰雅語與日本話。

column1: Kla kndadax slaqi siida, smnluhay kari Tanah Tunux, Tayal ka qrijil na, qpqhan na hiya o hbaraw bi ka klaan na seejiq Khilang, kiya ni egu bi ka klaan na rmngaw kari.
column2: I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Atayal, and he knows many Hakkas at work, so he can speak so many languages.
column3: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是泰雅族人，而他工作上認識許多客家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。

column1: Smiling nami siida, smnru egu bi quri knklaan rdrudan sbiyaw ka rudan nii.
column2: During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.
column3: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。

column1: Ana nanaq ini lxani mkla qmbahang o, ida nami wada sru-ing ruwan qnawal baga, tduwa saun qmbahang duri.
column2: Although we could’t fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.
column3: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。

column1: Slaqi ku siida, ini ku kla kndusan rudan sbiyaw, sqaun mu saw pneiyah ku seejiq tnpusu ka yaku.
column2: When I was young, I didn’t understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.
column3: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。

column1: Egu ka klaun do pqniqan nanaq lnglungan da, mqaras ku balay, yasa Seejiq ku Balay ka yaku.
column2: The more I know, the more I feel that being a Seejiq is unique and something to be proud of.
column3: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為賽德克族，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。

column1: Meiyah sapah gbiyan kiya da swayi snaw.
column2: My younger brother is going home this evening.
column3: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。

column1: Yaku ni bubu rudan o musa nami marig hiyi rudux brigan damac, sramal swayi snaw mhapuy uqun keeman.
column2: My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.
column3: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。

column1: Mnuda nami bbrigan sama, niqan egu bi klgan sama ka bbrigan sama hiya.
column2: We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.
column3: 我們經過了菜攤，那裏有好多新鮮的青菜。

column1: Bnarig nami eyncay, lmbay ni ningjing.
column2: We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.
column3: 我們買了空心菜、山藥和胡蘿蔔。

column1: Rmngaw ka gaga mniq siyaw bbrigan hiyi qhuni embbarig, “Shiya bi uqun ka kalac mu ni qlupas mu, brigi cikuh hug!” msa.
column2: The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”
column3: 在旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜。買一些吧!」

column1: Bnarig nami kalac ni qlupas.
column2: We bought pineapples and peaches.
column3: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。

column1: Muda nami bbrigan hiyi rudux siida, rmngaw ka embbarig, “Marig su manu hug? Paru ni msiyang ka hiyi rudux nii, kingal o tru kbkuy brigan.” msa.
column2: We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today’s chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”
column3: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」

column1: Sihan mkray bi brigan bubu rudan, kiya ni smiling embbarig, “Ya tduwa mhnuk hari brigan hug?”
column2: Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.
column3: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆:「可不可以便宜一點？」

column1: Kiya ka kiya ni embbarig o suqi mhnuk da! msa rmngaw ka embbarig, uxay tduwa blihun da.
column2: But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.
column3: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。

column1: Siyaw na embbarig o, “Aguh marig qsurux mu, paru ni mhnuk brigan ka qsurux mu.” msa.
column2: The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.
column3: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。

column1: Hici do bnarig nami hiyi rudux ni hiyi qsurux, musa nami sapah do egu ka hnapuy nami damac.
column2: In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.
column3: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。

column1: Bsiyaq ka tnaga do, mkuung ka karac da.
column2: After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.
column3: 等了好久，天已經黑了。

column1: Miyah ka qnawal swayi snaw rmngaw, “ini tduwa msangay ka hey-tay, asi ka babaw jiyax sngayan do kika miyah ku da.” msa.
column2: The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn’t take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.
column3: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。

column1: Rmngaw ka bubu rudan, “Egu balay ka hnapuy damac, lwani kana ka dhiya, aguh mkan” ksa.
column2: Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let’s eat together!
column3: 奶奶說:「已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!」

column1: Lwanun nami ka lupung ni dangi, aguh seupu mkan egu nhapuy keeman.
column2: We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.
column3: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。

column1: Niqan kingal ka tnhiyan mu muyas patas, Basaw ka hangan na, ida smhungi madas qyqaya kjiyax.
column2: I have a classmate named Basaw, he often forgets to bring things.
column3: 我有一個同學叫Basaw，他常常忘記帶東西。

column1: Smluhay siida, kmbarux ppatas, ssrus uxay uri o klabuy spatas gnexalan ka hiya.
column2: During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.
column3: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。

column1: Enkingal, endha, entru, srwaun dha kmbarux qyqaya ka hiya.
column2: Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.
column3: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。

column1: Kiya ka kiya ni mluhay kmbarux do ini na bqani ka knbrxan na da.
column2: But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.
column3: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。

column1: Hici do ini nami srwai kmbarux qyqaya da.
column2: In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.
column3: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。

column1: Niqan kingal jiyax, seupu nami musa mkksa nganguc.
column2: One day, we all went on an outing together.
column3: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。

column1: Mkksa ni mkmusa saan psnganguc ka Basaw, ida ini adas klabuy ssrus ka hiya.
column2: On the way, Basaw wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.
column3: 路途中，Basaw想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。

column1: Kiya ni kmbarux klabuy ssrus gnexalan ka hiya, ida smiyuk rmngaw hyaan ini ku adas uri msa.
column2: He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn’t bring them either.
column3: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。

column1: Basaw o tbiyax mlingis da, msaang rmngaw ni, “Ma namu ini sruwa kmbarux klabuy ssrus knan kana!”
column2: Basaw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don’t everyone lend me toilet paper!
column3: Basaw急的哭了出來。他生氣的說:「為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!!」

column1: Rmngaw hyaan ka gnexalan, yasa ini su nanaq adas ni kbrxun su o ini su bqani da!
column2: The classmate told him, because you didn’t bring it yourself, and you wouldn’t return the things lent to you!
column3: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!

column1: Kusun do, mgrbu bi miyah sapah pyasan ka Basaw, bqanan na gnexalan kana ka knbrxan na qyqaya.
column2: The next day at school, Basaw arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.
column3: 隔天上學，Basaw很早就到學校了，把跟同Basaw學借的東西都還給同學們。

column1: Msiqa ni rmngaw gnexalan na ka Basaw, kiya ni rmngaw, “peadas ku nanaq qyqaya babaw da, mhuway namu balay knbarux qyqaya knan.”
column2: Basaw aw apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.
column3: Basaw向同學們道歉，並說:「他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。」

column1: Emptsamac alang ka tama mu.
column2: My dad is a hunter of the tribe.
column3: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。

column1: Slaqi ku siida, tama ni swayi snaw tama ga keeman do madas pucing ni puniq wada lmiqu.
column2: When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.
column3: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。

column1: Mrdax ka karac do madas nangal dha samac miyah da.
column2: At daybreak, they returned with their prey.
column3: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。

column1: Mnsuwil madas bowyak, mnsuwil madas rapic, mnsuwil niqan ka glaqung uri.
column2: Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.
column3: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。

column1: Qhduun dha measug rhngun nganguc han, kika seasug seejiq tnealang da.
column2: They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.
column3: 他們會在村口將獵物分好，分享給族人。

column1: Rngagun mu kjiyax ka tama, mkmusa ku snegul tama musa tmsamac.
column2: Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.
column3: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。

column1: “Paru su do dsun misu lmiqu da.” msa ka tama.
column2: Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.
column3: 爸爸說:「等我長大了他再帶我一起去。」

column1: Ida mduuy durang qmraq ssamac uri ka dsnaw alang, mkla smalu durang ni dangar ka dhiya.
column2: The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.
column3: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。

column1: Ida mkla bi smalu durang ka tama mu, “Sqraq glaqung ka nii, bliqun nami kmuruy ka daping qaqay ssamac, bsaun elug daun ssamac ka durang.” msa ka tama.
column2: My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.
column3: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

column1: Iyux bi knhari seupu drudan musa tmsamac, kiya ni sluhay ku smalu durang kdjiyax, ini biyaw tduwan qmraq samac ka durang mu da.
column2: In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.
column3: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。

column1: Qmita ka tama do rmngaw knan, “isu ka musa mkla bi tmsamac hici da” msa.
column2: Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.
column3: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定很會打獵。

column1: Sayang do paru ku da, meapa ku bhniq ni buji mu, sneegul ku tama musa tmsamac.
column2: Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.
column3: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。

column1: Dhuq alang do seasug mu seejiq tnealang ka nangal mu ssamac.
column2: When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.
column3: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。

column1: “Ida gnealu utux rudan ka nii, seangal ta na egu bi ssamac.” msa ka tama.
column2: Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.
column3: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。

column1: Msuqi ku musa sapah pyasan ka mrbu da.
column2: I was late for school this morning.
column3: 我早上上學遲到了。

column1: Shungi ku madas lubuy patas ka musa sapah pyasan da.
column2: When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.
column3: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。

column1: Ini ku adas ana manu.
column2: I didn't bring anything with me.
column3: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。

column1: Meuyas patas siida, mseupu nami qmita patas ka thiyan mu muyas patas.
column2: During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.
column3: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。

column1: Pnspungan siida, kbxan ku na ppatas ni ssrus ka thiyan mu muyas patas.
column2: During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.
column3: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。

column1: Rngagan ku na ka emptgsa, “nhari tutuy ka babaw na da, iya hari msuqi da!”
column2: The teacher told me, Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""
column3: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」

column1: Dangi mu ka Tusan, laqi seejiq balay ka hiya uri.
column2: My good friend’s name is Tusan, and he is also an Seejiq child.
column3: 我的好朋友叫Tusan，他也是賽德克族的小孩。

column1: Mseupu nami muyas patas alang Truku.
column2: We study together in the Truku tribe.
column3: 我們一起在德鹿谷部落讀書。

column1: Qbahang nami snruan kari ka rudan sbiyaw kdjiyax, mkla nami balay rmngaw kari seejiq balay.
column2: We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the seejiq proficiently.
column3: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說賽德克語。

column1: Bowqax ni qthur ka yaku, llbu ni mliwang ka Tusan.
column2: I am tall and overweight, while Tusan is short and thin.
column3: 我很高也很胖，Tusan很矮也很瘦。

column1: Niqan bi bbiyax ka Tusan, smkuxul hiya kana ka seejiq.
column2: Tusan is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.
column3: Tusan很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。

column1: Yun-tung-kay sapah pyasan ka sayang, mowda egu bi pspung ka sapah pyasan.
column2: Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.
column3: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。

column1: NIqan brbil wasil, boru qqahan, tmalang, rmgrig ni smbu buji.
column2: There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.
column3: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。

column1: Pspung ku tmalang ka yaku.
column2: I participated in the running competition.
column3: 我比賽跑步。

column1: Tmalang ku siida o, mtakur ku da msdara egu bi ka pungu qaqay mu.
column2: When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.
column3: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。

column1: Ida ku tutuy, tmalang ku musa brah duri.
column2: But I stood up and continued running forward.
column3: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。

column1: Dhuq ku siida mqaras bi kana ka dhiya.
column2: Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.
column3: 我到終點時所有人都很開心。

column1: Ana ku ini angal kaci, ida ku mqaras bi, yasa wada ku mnhdu pspung da.
column2: Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.
column3: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。

column1: Shiga, Mnusa nami qmita swayi snaw Tama mu ka dha nami Tama mu.
column2: Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.
column3: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。

column1: Gaga mangal luqih ka qaqay swayi snaw Tama mu.
column2: My uncle injured his foot.
column3: 叔叔的腳受傷了。

column1: Rmngaw yami ka hiya, gaga mbling ka babaw dnamux.
column2: He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.
column3: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。

column1: Smalu dnamux siida ka hiya o, dburuq knnadax dnamux da.
column2: He fell off the roof while repairing it.
column3: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。

column1: Madas wawa dapa ni pinglang ka Tama mu, bqana na swayi na snaw.
column2: My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.
column3: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。

column1: Pprngaw nami tqiyan ka dha nami swayi snaw Tama mu, egubi ka snluan kari niya.
column2: My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.
column3: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。

column1: Mmusa ku siida, rngagan ku na masu wada mdakil bi hnigan ni mseejiq bi ka swayi snaw Tama mu.
column2: Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.
column3: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。

column1: Smiyuk ku rnngaw, “tay malu ka qaqay su da o, iyax bi mseupu tuhuy sapah.”
column2: I said, When your foot gets better
column3: come to our house next time and visit us.""
column4: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」

column1: Hngkawas empusal kbkuy empusal dha siida, mneuda pprngaw ka klwaan tduwa burux powsa hangan kari ta nanaq ka patas hnyigan Seejiq Tnpusu.
column2: In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.
column3: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。

column1: Smniling ku risaw alang Walis Huwac, hiya o bsiyaq balay mquri klwaan embiyax meysa patas hnyigan “ burux powsa hangan kari ta nanaq.
column2: I interviewed Walis Huwac, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.
column3: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Walis Huwac。

column1: Mnhdu nami pprngaw , jiyax sngayan nii musa sapah na smiling hyaan.
column2: We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.
column3: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。

column1: Saw mniq sniling siida, pgkla knan pnyahan hangan na, dsun ku na pgkla kingal ruwan sapah na ni alang na uri.
column2: During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.
column3: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。

column1: Smiling ku hyaan, hmuya ma su ida mkray lnglungan priyux hangan, uda powsa patas seuxal o naqih kiya hug?
column2: I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn’t the old registration method sufficient?
column3: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?

column1: Rngagan ku na, yaasa dmuuy kari Tlu o ini sleexan balay pgkla hanagan na, duma seejiq “瓦先生” msa mlawa hyaan uri, kiya ni saw bi smhulis.
column2: He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Wa Xian Sheng
column3: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
column4: 他對我說，因為用中文字並不能準確的傳達他的名字，其他人還會叫他「瓦先生」，也因此鬧出不少笑話。

column1: Rmngaw ka Walis Huwac, “Hangan bnatas kari Seejiq Tnpusu o kika balay bi hangan ta. Hangan mu o ririh saw pgkla klgan seejiq ta, tnsapah ta, hnyigan ta, tay saw emphbaraw balay ka seejiq dhuq hmlay hangan dha nanaq.”
column2: Walis Huwac said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group
column3: our family
column4: our identity. I hope more fellow tribespeople can reclaim their own names.\""
column5: Walis Huwac說：「原住民語書寫的名字才是我們真正的名字。我的名字代表了我們的族群、我們的家族、我們的身分，希望能有更多族人找回自己的名字。」

column1: Shiga o musa sbrigan smbarig ka yaku ni bubu rudan, madas egu bi ssama nhuma na nanaq ka bubu rudan, smmalu uuqun Seejiq Tnpusu uri biqan na ana ima.
column2: Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.
column3: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。

column1: Smkuxul bi sbrigan bubu rudan ka kana seejiq, hbaraw bi seejiq marig usik ni bunga, hbaraw bi seejiq miyah mkan nhapuy hnpuyan na.
column2: Everyone loved my grandmother’s stall. Many people bought the chilis and sweet potato, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.
column3: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和地瓜很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。

column1: Lmala ni hlama dhquy hnpuyan na o malu balay uqan, niqan muduh hiyi bowyak uri, hmguc hbaraw lupung mniyah ka knux na, miyah tqnay sbrigan nami kana.
column2: The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.
column3: 她煮的過貓和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。

column1: Mhapuy siida ka bubu rudan, mniq ku siyaw kmeaguh lupung ka yaku, mjiras ku mlawa siyaw, “Hmaan nanaq kana ka ssama, ini rusi sapuh, iyah marig nhari wah!”
column2: While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown
column3: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
column4: 奶奶煮東西的時候，我在旁邊招攬客人。我在一旁大喊著：「蔬菜都是自己種的，天然有機，趕快來買喔!」

column1: Ini biyaw qduun smbarig kana ka qyqaya nami da, “Nuxay bi jiyagan su” msa ka bubu rudan.
column2: Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It’s all thanks to your help.\""
column3: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」

column1: Euda nii, wada ku smluhay pnegluban quri knkla pnhmaan ni uqun Seejiq Tnpusu, duri ni mkrbuk muda smbarig.
column2: Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.
column3: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。

column1: Qmita ku bubu rudan smkuxul bi uuqun Seejiq Tnpusu smparu ni mqaras bi lnglungan mu.
column2: Seeing my grandmother’s passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
column3: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常驕傲和榮幸。
